Sadie Sink was incredible

This is one of my favorites in the fear street trilogy, it actually does feel like 1978, and also, I love the references to older slasher movies such as Friday the 13th and the shining, and it also has great gore once again, but also the ending genuinely made me tear up. I highly highly recommend fear Street part two.

This second Fear Street movie was great. Sadie Sink, Emily Rudd, Ryan Simpkins, Gillian Jacobs, McCabe Slye, Ted Sutherland, Jordana Spiro, and the rest of the cast did a great job in this movie. The plot of the movie was insane and thrilling. It's about what happened at a summer camp in Shadyside and how it's connected to the first movie. If you haven't seen Part 2 of this trilogy yet, check it out sometime, but see them in order. It'll all make sense.
Love this trilogy, great sequel to the first movie

I absolutely couldn't wait to watch this after getting through Part One this afternoon, and it more than lived up to my expectations. 

Whereas the first film was a decent but very flawed love letter to 90s horror, this movie is a more clear reference to 80s slashers, especially Friday the 13th. But it's so much more than that. I genuinely cared about these characters (a standout performance by Sadie Sink, who between this and Stranger Things is one of my favorite young actresses, helped a lot there), and was tearing up during the ending. Add to that great expansions to the lore, a darker, gorier story, and an intriguing twist to perfectly set up the next film, and you have a rare middle chapter that stands out. I'm unbelievably hyped to watch Part Three.
Fear street part 2 is an awesome prequel with a great twist and a savage killer.

Fear Street Part Two: 1978 improves slightly over its predecessor but the story is less interesting and has an ok performance by all the cast.

As a standalone, it’s a fast, fun watch with lots of nods to classic films and a good sense of humour, but as part of a whole, Fear Street is building to become something genuinely unique and special of its own.
Although I prefer the first one, this sequel is a fun and intense while also paying homage to other camp slashers.-💀💩L
my favorite of the three, the characters, the setting, the plot, all was definitely better in this one. The Berman sisters are superior

Like Empire Strikes Back & Back to the Future 2, this one is a solid middle story that takes us back to the age of CAMP BLOOD & THE CROPSEY MANIAC. Anyone who grew up watching cut up slasher flicks on TV will dig this gem.
Really good.
By far the best of the series and that still stands with the release of the fourth in the series.  All the characters were compelling and it had a mixed feel of Scream and Friday the 13th.
